intro: Ouratea tarapotensis, commonly known as the Peruvian ouratea, is a small evergreen tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by dark blue, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
